faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to your questions about our private notary service

q1.question: Is your notarization officially recognized?
q1.answer: Yes. Our private notary is licensed and officially approved by the Abu Dhabi Judicial Department. All documents notarized through us carry the same legal validity as those issued by government notary centers.

q2.question: Can you visit my office or home?
q2.answer: Absolutely ‚Äî this is our key advantage. We can come to you anywhere within Abu Dhabi (office, home, or even hospital) at a time that suits you to complete the process.

q3.question: How long does the notarization take?
q3.answer: Once the appointment is confirmed and the document draft is reviewed, notarization and signing are completed in the same session and you receive your notarized document immediately. The session usually takes no more than 15‚Äì30 minutes.

q4.question: What documents are required for notarization?
q4.answer: In general, a valid original Emirates ID is required for all signing parties, or a passport. Some special transactions (such as company contracts) may require additional documents, which will be clarified upon contact.

hero.title: From Incorporation to Litigation ‚Äî Comprehensive Legal Protection for Your Company in the UAE
hero.desc: We establish your company on solid legal foundations through precise drafting, and safeguard your interests with strength and professionalism across all legal disputes and commercial litigation.

faq.title: Legal Solutions for Your Business Challenges
faq.subtitle: Click on a question to view the solution we provide to our clients

q1.question: How does Ali Al Khajeh Law Firm ensure that commercial contracts are free from legal loopholes?
q1.answer: We do not rely on ready-made contract templates. Instead, every contract is "custom-drafted" according to the nature of your business and its potential risks. Our team analyzes future dispute scenarios before they arise and includes protective clauses that strengthen your legal position. This significantly reduces the likelihood of litigation and safeguards your investments from any misinterpretation of the law.

q2.question: In the event of a commercial dispute, how long does it typically take to resolve a case?
q2.answer: The duration depends on the complexity of the case, but our strategy is built on "smart and efficient solutions." We first aim for amicable settlement or arbitration to minimize time and costs. If litigation becomes necessary, our deep expertise in UAE court procedures ensures that the case moves forward as quickly as possible, with close follow-up to secure your rights without delay.

q3.question: Why do I need a full-service law firm from the incorporation stage instead of hiring a lawyer only when a problem occurs?
q3.answer: Prevention is always less costly than cure. Starting with us from the incorporation stage ensures that your company‚Äôs "legal structure" is sound from day one, preventing disputes caused by unclear partnerships or weak contract drafting. If any issue arises, our team will already be fully familiar with your company‚Äôs details, making our defense stronger and faster.

q4.question: How does the firm help in recovering outstanding commercial debts within the UAE?
q4.answer: We have a specialized "debt recovery" department that follows a progressive legal approach, starting with formal notices and mediation, and escalating to strict judicial enforcement if required. We focus on achieving tangible results, restoring your company‚Äôs cash flow, and protecting your commercial reputation while adhering to all applicable legal regulations.

q5.question: Does the firm regularly update our contracts based on ongoing changes in UAE laws?
q5.answer: Yes, this is one of the key advantages of our partnership with clients. The legal environment in the UAE (including company, labor, and tax laws) evolves continuously. We are committed to notifying you of any legal updates affecting your business and to revising your contracts and internal policies to ensure full compliance and avoid fines or administrative penalties.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to your most important legal inquiries

q1.question: How long do divorce or khula procedures take in UAE courts?
q1.answer: The time frame varies depending on the nature of the case, and whether it will end amicably or through litigation. At Ali Al Khaja Law Firm, we prioritize the ‚Äútime factor‚Äù; we utilize all legal tools and negotiation expertise to ensure that procedures are resolved in the shortest possible timeframe, thus protecting our clients‚Äô interests and minimizing the psychological and financial burdens resulting from prolonged disputes.

q2.question: Does filing for "Khula" affect my rights to child custody or financial support?
q2.answer: No, absolutely not. Khula' is about ending the marital relationship in exchange for financial compensation (returning the dowry and alimony), but the children's rights of custody, alimony and housing are established rights by force of law and are not affected by the request for Khula', and we guarantee that these rights will be established for you in the Khula' agreement.

q3.question: What types of "harm" are now recognized by UAE courts as valid grounds for divorce under the recent legal updates?
q3.answer: Recent legislative updates in the UAE have expanded recognized forms of harm to protect the affected party. Addiction (in all forms) is now legally recognized as direct grounds for divorce due to harm, in addition to abandonment, psychological or physical abuse, and failure to provide financial support. At Ali Al Khajeh Law Office, we have the expertise to present the legal evidence required to prove such harm under the new standards, ensuring your case is resolved efficiently and that you receive all your legal rights as quickly as possible.

q4.question: How does the firm ensure confidentiality of my sensitive case information?
q4.answer: Confidentiality is our top principle. We apply strict systems in handling documents and information, and our legal team is trained to manage personal status cases with the highest level of discretion and privacy, ensuring that your personal matters remain strictly within the office and court environment.

q5.question: I am a resident in the UAE ‚Äî will my home country‚Äôs law or UAE law be applied?
q5.answer: UAE law is generally the primary law applied, unless one party requests the application of their home country‚Äôs law under specific conditions. We specialize in guiding residents to choose the legal path that ensures the best outcome with minimal losses, while also ensuring that the results are legally recognized in their home country.

items.text: I had the honor of dealing with Ali Al Khajeh Law Office, and my experience with them was outstanding in every aspect. The team demonstrated high professionalism and complete clarity in explaining legal procedures, giving me a sense of trust and reassurance throughout my case follow-up ‚Äî which is a very important point. I am grateful to the entire team who communicated with me, and I would especially like to thank Attorney Mohamed Hassan, who showed the utmost professionalism and courtesy. Thanks to his efforts, the case was resolved with a satisfactory settlement. I highly recommend this office to anyone seeking efficiency and credibility in legal matters.
items.name: A UAE Client

items.text: Ali Al Khajeh Law Office was the only law firm in Abu Dhabi that agreed to take my case due to its complexity, while most other firms refused to risk it fearing loss. From the beginning, I sensed the competence and expertise of their legal team, especially Mr. Mohamed Farghaly, who demonstrated deep understanding of the law and legal loopholes I was unaware of. Even after winning the case, they continued to follow it closely to ensure I received all my legal rights, particularly Mr. Ibrahim Nageh, who put in extraordinary effort. For this reason, I decided to write this review to recommend them based on my personal experience.

items.text: I would like to thank all the staff at Counselor Ali Al Khajeh‚Äôs office, with special appreciation to Counselor Mohamed and Mr. Nidal. My case initially seemed hopeless, but with God‚Äôs grace and the team‚Äôs efforts, it did not take long to resolve it. Thank God.

items.text: At first, honestly, my case was complicated. I presented it to several lawyers, but unfortunately it was rejected. When I went to Al Khajeh‚Äôs office, they accepted it, and I was able to recover all my rights, thank God. Thanks to everyone who stood by me, and to all the staff at Al Khajeh‚Äôs office. Special thanks to Mr. Mohamed Farghaly and Mr. Ibrahim ‚Äî very professional and respectful service.

items.text: Although my case was small and didn‚Äôt seem worthy of going to a large office like Ali Al Khajeh‚Äôs, I decided to try my luck. When I arrived, I was surprised by the number of staff, clients, and offices, which made me hesitate at first. However, once I entered, the receptionist Hanan welcomed me warmly, treated me excellently, and helped me fill out the form. Within 10 minutes, I met with the legal consultant, who provided the solution in just a minute. I never expected the issue to be resolved so quickly. May God bless your efforts.

hero.titleLine2: Your Complete Guide to Making the Right Legal Decision
hero.desc: With over 20 years of legal expertise at Ali Al Khajeh Law Firm, we provide comprehensive legal consultations (commercial, civil, criminal, and personal status) ensuring security, clarity, and the right decision.

services.title: Why is legal consultation with an expert firm your first investment in security?
services.doc: In the UAE, the legislative environment is precise and continuously evolving; therefore, obtaining advice from a trusted and professional law firm is not just a procedure ‚Äî it is a protective shield that prevents costly legal consequences. Choosing Ali Al Khajeh Law Firm guarantees you:

business.title: A precise analysis of your legal position
business.desc: We don‚Äôt provide rigid legal texts; instead, we deeply analyze your situation to uncover opportunities and risks that a non-specialist eye might miss.

family.title: Proactive protection from legal gaps
family.desc: Our extensive experience in UAE courts allows us to anticipate obstacles before they occur, saving you years of disputes and financial costs.

insurance.title: Absolute clarity and transparency
insurance.desc: We believe you have the right to know the full truth; therefore, we provide a realistic and decisive evaluation of your legal chances, helping you make decisions based on solid facts, not promises.

industrial.title: Tailored solutions, not ready-made templates
industrial.desc: Every client has a unique case, so we design a legal strategy that perfectly fits your goals, whether you are an individual protecting personal rights or an investor securing your business.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to your most important legal inquiries

q1.question: Can I get legal consultation remotely?
q1.answer: Yes, to value your time, we offer legal consultations via online video communication or by phone. We also welcome you to our office for in-person consultations.

q2.question: What documents are required before the consultation?
q2.answer: To provide the most accurate legal opinion, please prepare all contracts, correspondence, or documents related to your matter. Our team will guide you once the appointment is confirmed.

q3.question: Is the information I share during the consultation confidential?
q3.answer: Confidentiality is the cornerstone of our work. Ali Al Khajeh Law Firm adheres to the highest standards of professional confidentiality under UAE legal practice laws.

q4.question: How long does the consultation session usually take?
q4.answer: A consultation session typically lasts 45 to 60 minutes, focusing on analyzing facts, defining the legal position, and providing a clear roadmap.

q5.question: Does the consultation guarantee the result I hope for?
q5.answer: We are committed to professional integrity; therefore, we do not give false promises. Instead, we provide a realistic evaluation of your chances and risks based on experience and judicial precedents.

faq.title: Legal Solutions for Your Business Challenges

q1.question: Does the firm represent clients across all Emirates?
q1.answer: Yes, our firm represents clients before all federal and local courts at all levels (First Instance, Appeal, Cassation) across the UAE to ensure full access to justice.

q2.question: How can I book and receive a legal consultation?
q2.answer: You may book your consultation through our website or by direct contact. We offer in-office consultations as well as remote legal consultations for your convenience and faster response.

q3.question: What legal specializations does your team cover?
q3.answer: Our firm includes specialists across all branches of law, including family matters, commercial disputes, criminal cases, and real estate, delivering comprehensive and precise legal solutions.

q4.question: Are your legal services limited to a specific category of clients?
q4.answer: Our services are available to all citizens, residents, and companies in the UAE. We are committed to providing legal advice and representation in compliance with all local regulations and legislation.

q5.question: What distinguishes Ali Al Khajeh Law Firm from other law firms?
q5.answer: We are distinguished by our extensive experience within the local judiciary, absolute transparency with our clients, and our commitment to developing innovative legal strategies that ensure the best results and protect our clients‚Äô interests.

about.header: Who is Ali Al Khajeh? And Why is He Among the Best in the UAE?
about.paragraph: Ali Al Khajeh Law Firm was established in 2016 by Ali Al Khajeh, a lawyer, legal consultant, private notary public, and certified contract authenticator. He began his professional journey immediately after graduating from the Dubai Police Academy and has received numerous honors and recognitions, including a Certificate of Appreciation from the Abu Dhabi Chamber of Commerce in 2018, recognition from the Abu Dhabi Judicial Department in 2019, and his firm ranking fourth among the Top 100 Law Firms under the Nafis Initiative at the Commercial Partial Cases Performance Conference held in Dubai in 2022.
